projectDetail1348.description: General Plan Amendment (GPA) to change the land use from Open Space to Public/Semi Public, Planned Development Rezone (Stage 1 Development Plan) and Tentative Parcel Map. The proposal is for an assisted living facility of up to 95 beds on Parcel 3 of the Valley Christian Center property. The GPA includes changing the land use on a portion of Parcel 1 from Public/Semi Public to Open Space

projectDetail1340.description: A new 35,089 square foot building on Parcel 2 of the Valley Christian Center property. The new building proposed as a memory care facility providing 55 beds in both private and shared rooms.

projectDetail1300.description: Site Development Review Permit for modifications to the former Hooter’s building, including creating two tenant spaces, a 568-square-foot addition, a new trash enclosure, and outdoor seating. The request also includes a Conditional Use Permit to establish a drive-thru and associated parking.

projectDetail1189.title: East Ranch (Croak Property)

details.Application Type: Stage II Planned Development and Vesting Tentative Parcel Map
details.General Plan Land Use: Low-Density Residential, Medium-Density Residential, Rural Residential/Agriculture, Parks/Public Recreation, Open Space, Semi-Public

Applicant.name: Trumark Homes, LLC
Applicant.address: 3001 Bishop Drive, Suite 100, San Ramon, CA 94583

projectDetail1189.description: The Applicant, Trumark Homes, LLC, filed a Stage II Planned Development and Vesting Tentative Parcel Map Application for the development of a 573-unit residential project (including 108 Medium Density Residential units and 465 Low-Density Single-Family Residential units), as well as 11.5 acres of public parks, a 2.6-acre Amenity Site, and a two-acre Semi-Public Site. The proposed development includes seven home programs, ranging from three to ten units per acre. The proposed development is designed with four architecture styles: Traditional Farmhouse, Modern Farmhouse, California Revival, and Contemporary, as shown in the project plans. The use of the Semi-Public Site has not been determined.

projectDetail1139.title: Tru Hotel and Element Hotel

details.Application Type: Site Development Review
details.Building Area: 84,476 – Element Hotel and 53,873 – Tru Hotel square feet

Applicant.name: Kevin Fryer
Applicant.address: Mission Valley Homes

projectDetail1139.description: Site Development Review permit for two new hotels and an area for a future pad building development on an existing vacant lot, including one 84,476 sf hotel of five stories at seventy (70’) feet high, with 129 rooms, known as Element Hotel; one 53,873 sf hotel of six stories, at sixty seven (67’) feet high, including 120 rooms, known as Tru Hotel; and a pad for future development of seventy one (71’) feet by seventy one (71’) feet. The proposal includes 322 parking spaces, circulation, landscaping and site improvements.

Applicant.address: 1840 San Miguel Drive, Ste. 206, Walnut Creek, CA 94596

docs.name: Planning Commission April 28, 2020 Agenda & Staff Report

projectDetail1128.description: Site Development Review Permit to construct a new 138 room hotel in the parking lot south of the existing office building (Corrie Center). The proposed 4-story hotel is located above a 2-story parking structure to be shared with the existing office building. The applications include a minor use permit for shared parking, Heritage Tree Removal Permit to remove two Coast redwoods, community benefit agreement and related improvements to landscaping and parking.

projectDetail1075.title: Westin Hotel

Applicant.name: Charles Patel

projectDetail1075.description: The Westin Hotel project is a proposal for a Tentative Parcel Map, Site Development Review Permit, and a Stage 2 Development Plan for a 163,133 square foot, 6-story hotel. The site consists of a 5.88-acre parcel located at the southeast corner of Campus Drive and Altamirano Avenue, adjacent to the existing East Dublin BART Station. The hotel will include a 5,254 square foot restaurant, a ballroom, 2 large meeting rooms, and 198 hotel rooms.

Applicant.address: 3750 Boulder Street, Pleasanton, CA 94506

projectDetail1071.description: The property owner, Dr Sabri Arac, is requesting approval of a Site Development Review Permit to construct a new 26,000 square foot building to house the Quarry Lane Pre-School. The proposed facility will include 15 classrooms, activity rooms (i.e. music, library, art, and staff rooms) and related site improvements including onsite parking, frontage and landscape improvements, and a 10,000 square foot outdoor children’s play area including play structures.

The site has a General Plan and Eastern Dublin Specific Plan land use designation of High Density Residential (25+ units per acre) and Planned Development Zoning with a Stage 1 Development Plan that permits a high density residential development.

projectDetail935.title: Grand View Project

details.Application Type: Pre-Application
details.General Plan Land Use: General Commercial, General Commercial/Campus Office, Open Space and Medium/High Density Residential

Applicant.name: Jessica Zhang, GH PacVest, LLC
Applicant.address: 3000 Executive Pkwy, #375, San Ramon, CA 94583

projectDetail935.description: The property owner has submitted a Pre-Application for the proposed Grand View Project. The conceptual proposal is for a mixed use project comprised of up to 2,391,668 square feet of retail/commercial and office uses and up to 338 housing units. Preliminary concepts for the project include a pedestrian oriented “main street” that would be supported by retail, office, hotels and recreational uses. The proposed project would include the extension of Dublin Boulevard and improvements to Croak Road in order to accommodate the proposed development. If the project were to move forward, future entitlements may include Planned Development Zoning, Site Development Review for each component of the project, a Tentative Map(s), and environment review in accordance with the California Environmental Quality Act.

projectDetail486.title: Boulevard (Dublin Crossing) Phase 2 & 3

details.Application Type: Site Development Review, Vesting Tenative Tract Map

Applicant.name: Joe Guerra, Dublin Crossing LLC/Brookfield Residential
Applicant.address: 500 La Gonda Way, Suite 100, Danville, CA 94526

docs.name: Planning Commission Staff Report 04.11.17 Study Session

projectDetail486.description: Multi-phased development comprised of up to 1,995 residential units, up to 200,000 square feet of commercial uses, 35 acres of public parkland, a 12-acre elementary school site and related infrastructure. The overall project specific plan (Dublin Crossing Specific Plan) was approved in 2013. Together, Phases 2 and 3 propose a total of 791 units in 12 neighborhoods. Phase 2 is comprised of 508 units on approximately 36.25 acres and Phase 3 is comprised of 283 units on approximately 18.22 acres. The Planning Commission held two study sessions on April 11 and April 25 to review Phases 2 and 3.

projectDetail71.title: Boulevard (Dublin Crossing)

details.Application Type: General Plan Amendment, Planned Development Rezone with Stage 1 and 2 Development Plan, Vesting Tentative Tract Map

Applicant.name: Joe Guerra, Dublin Crossing LLC/Brookfield Residential
Applicant.address: 500 La Gonda Way, Suite 100, Danville, CA 94526

projectDetail71.description: Multi-phased development comprised of up to 1,995 residential units, up to 200,000 square feet of commercial uses, 35 acres of public parkland, a 12-acre elementary school site and related infrastructure. The overall project specific plan (Dublin Crossing Specific Plan) was approved in 2013. Site improvements for the first phase of development is underway. Design review for the first six residential neighborhoods (Phases 1A and 1B) were approved by the Planning Commission on June 14, 2016. On May 9, 2017 the Planning Commission approved the design of the 12 residential neighborhoods in Phases 2 and 3 and on May 8, 2018, the Planning Commission approved the design of the remaining six residential neighborhoods in Phases 4 and 5. The project is currently under construction.

projectDetail175.title: Jordan Ranch – Onyx (Neighborhood 7)

details.Application Type: General Plan and Eastern Dublin Specific Plan Amendments and Planned Development Rezone with amended Stage 1 and Stage 2 Development Plans, Site Development Review, Vesting Tentative Tract Map 8267 & 8269, and Development Agreement Amendment
details.Zoning: PD- Medium Density Residential, PD-Medium High Density Residential, PD-Public/Semi-Public underlay, and PD-Mixed Use

Applicant.name: Jason Cole, TRI Pointe Homes
Applicant.address: 2010 Crow Canyon Place, Suite 380, San Ramon, CA 94583

projectDetail175.description: Neighborhood 7, “Onyx”, is part of the overall Jordan Ranch project. This neighborhood consists of 105 detached residential units on 10.1 acres. Primary access to the site is from Panorama Drive. All of these homes face onto a neighborhood street or a private park and take vehicular access from a motorcourt or driveway. The site plan includes extensive use of pedestrian paseos to interconnect the project and adjacent neighborhoods.

projectDetail150.title: Schaefer Ranch Unit 3

details.Application Type: General Plan Amendment, Planned Development Rezone, Site Development Review, Tentative Map and CEQA Addendum

Applicant.name: Louis Parsons, Discovery Builders
Applicant.address: 4061 Port Chicago Hwy, Suite H, Concord, CA 94520

projectDetail150.description: The Schaefer Unit 3 project included approval of a General Plan Amendment and Planned Development Zoning with a related Stage 1 and Stage 2 Development Plan to change the land use designation and zoning of 17.30 acres designated as Estate Residential and originally approved for 6 residential estate lots and common areas, to 7.04 acres designated as Single-Family Residential for 18 single-family detached homes and 10.26 acres designated as Open Space. This proposal results in a total of 418 homes (a net increase of 12 homes) within the Schaefer Ranch project. The application also included a Site Development Review Permit and Vesting Tentative Map for the proposed homes on the 18 lots. The project was approved by the City Council on June 21, 2016.

projectDetail30.description: The City received an application from IKEA to construct a store and a commercial center on a 27.5 acre site at 5144 and 5344 Martinelli Way. The proposed project is for up to 410,000 square feet of commercial uses includes a 317,000 square foot IKEA store with integrated podium parking and a 93,000 square foot commercial center with a mix of retail and restaurant spaces. The updated site plan submitted to the City can be reviewed by clicking on the thumbnail below.
